benchmark_details.name: D-HUMOR: Dark Humor Understanding via Multimodal Open-ended Reasoning
benchmark_details.overview: We introduce a novel dataset of 4,379 Reddit memes annotated for dark humor, target category (gender, mental health, violence, race, disability, and other), and a three-level intensity rating (mild, moderate, severe).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a resource for studying dark humor in memes and develop models for accurate detection, target identification, and intensity prediction.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Skewed toward the Gender/Sex-Related Topics label, reflecting the greater availability of such content online.

data.source: Memes collected from Reddit using the Reddit API, combined with OCR for text extraction.
data.annotation: Annotated for dark humor presence, target categories, and intensity levels.

methods: Feature extraction from text and images using BERT and ViT
methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on classification results of the proposed model and various baselines.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better detection and classification of dark humor, target identification, and intensity prediction.
methodology.baseline_results: TCRNet achieved 75.00% accuracy on dark humor detection and 62.72% accuracy on intensity prediction.
methodology.validation: Ablation studies confirmed the importance of structured explanations for model performance.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Dataset annotated to identify if humor targets sensitive topics affecting various demographic groups.
harm: Potential offense due to dark humor content

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Respect user privacy as per Reddit's policies; no personally identifiable information was collected.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Data collection adhered to ethical guidelines.
